instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3437 backlight fashes
threads.message:
a 820-3437 The voltage on the back light booster D7701 gradually drops from 33v to 8v.
the logic board turns on after 2 second turns of and than turn on ans stays on.
any suggestion?

threads.title: 820-3437 backlight fashes
threads.message:
Check XW7720 and FB solder under U7701...
R5490 is OK?

threads.title: 820-3437 backlight fashes
threads.message: Dear maybe it's a silly question but there is no XW7720 on the board between D7701 and L7701.

threads.title: 820-3437 backlight fashes
threads.message:
Is just a trace, near L7701.
It gets corroded many times...

threads.title: 820-3437 backlight fashes
threads.message: Thanks for your replay on R5490 1 and 2 have 8.6v but 3and 4 nothing

threads.title: 820-3437 backlight fashes
threads.message:
Did you change U7701?
Be sure it is properly soldered...

threads.title: 820-3437 backlight fashes
threads.message:
no sir i haven't replace the U7701 yet
Should I do it?
it lights up when it chimes and than the voltage on D7701 gradually drops to 8.5 which is my ppbus-G3h.
